info.name: Virtru Data Security Platform gRPC APIs
info.description:
Comprehensive collection for interacting with Virtru Data Security Platform gRPC endpoints.

**Services Included:**
- Authentication (Keycloak OAuth)
- Policy Service (Namespaces, Attributes, Values, Subject Mappings, Resource Mappings, Subject Condition Sets, Key Access Servers)
- KAS Service (Rewrap, PublicKey)
- Wellknown Service (Configuration)
- Authorization Service (Decisions, DecisionsByToken, Entitlements)
- Entity Resolution Service (CreateEntityChainFromJwt, ResolveEntities)
- Shared Service (GetMyEntitlements, TransformToICTDF, TransformToZTDF)
- Tagging PDP Service (v2)
- Policy Artifact Service (v1)
- NanoTDF Rewrap Service (v1)

- Policy Actions Service
- Policy Registered Resources Service
- Policy Key Management Service
- Policy Obligations Service
- Authorization Service v2
- Entity Resolution Service v2
- Config Service (KAS, Outlook, Secure Viewer, Tagging PDP)
- Web Admin Config Service
- Certificate Service
- Version Service
- Health Check Service

**Authentication:**
1. Configure Keycloak variables in the Variables tab
2. Run 'Get Access Token' request to authenticate
3. Token is automatically saved and used for all subsequent requests
4. Token auto-refresh on expiry

variable.description: Client secret for client credentials flow

exec: console.log('Username or password not set, skipping auto-refresh');

item.name: Authentication

exec: // Save access token to collection variable

request.description:
Get OAuth access token using password grant.

**Required Variables:**
- `keycloak_url`: Keycloak base URL
- `keycloak_realm`: Realm name
- `keycloak_client_id`: OAuth client ID
- `keycloak_username`: Your username
- `keycloak_password`: Your password

**Auto-saves token** to `auth_token` variable for use in all requests.

Get OAuth access token using client credentials grant.

**Use this for:**
- Service accounts
- Machine-to-machine authentication

**Required Variables:**
- `keycloak_client_id`: Service account client ID
- `keycloak_client_secret`: Client secret

Refresh an existing access token.

**Required:**
- Previous token request must have returned a refresh_token
- Refresh token must not be expired

item.description:
Authentication requests for obtaining OAuth tokens from Keycloak.

**Quick Start:**
1. Set credentials in Variables tab
2. Run 'Get Access Token (Password Grant)'
3. Token is auto-saved and used for all API calls

**Auto-Refresh:**
The collection automatically refreshes expired tokens before each request.

item.name: Policy Service
Namespaces

request.description:
Create a new namespace for organizing attributes.

**Namespace Lifecycle Step 1/5**

Namespaces are URIs that group related attributes together. Common patterns:
- `https://example.com/attr/classification` - Security classifications
- `https://example.com/attr/departments` - Department-based attributes
- `https://example.com/attr/projects` - Project-specific attributes

**Auto-saves:** `namespace_id` for use in subsequent requests

List all namespaces, optionally filtered by state.

**States:**
- ACTIVE: Currently active namespaces
- INACTIVE: Deactivated namespaces
- ANY: All namespaces regardless of state
Get details of a specific namespace by ID.

Update namespace metadata.

**Update Behaviors:**
- EXTEND: Merge new metadata with existing
- REPLACE: Replace all metadata with new values

Deactivate a namespace. This soft-deletes the namespace and all its attributes.

**Warning:** This action cascades to all attributes and values in the namespace.

Assign a public key to a namespace for encryption.

This method associates a public key with a namespace, enabling encryption of all data tagged with attributes in this namespace. The key can be either locally stored or remotely referenced.

**Use Cases:**
- Enable encryption at namespace level
- Set up default key material for all attributes in namespace
- Configure namespace-wide cryptographic protection

**Parameters:**
- `namespace_id`: UUID of the namespace
- `public_key.local`: PEM-encoded public key (local storage)
- `public_key.remote`: URL to remote public key (alternative to local)

Remove a public key from a namespace.

This method disassociates a public key from a namespace, disabling namespace-level encryption operations.

**Use Cases:**
- Namespace-level key rotation
- Revoke encryption capability for entire namespace
- Clean up unused key associations

**Parameters:**
- `namespace_id`: UUID of the namespace
- `public_key_id`: UUID of the public key to remove

Assign an X.509 certificate to a namespace for TLS/encryption.

This method associates an X.509 certificate with a namespace, enabling certificate-based authentication and encryption.

**Use Cases:**
- Enable mutual TLS for namespace operations
- Certificate-based key establishment
- PKI integration for namespace security

**Parameters:**
- `namespace_id`: UUID of the namespace
- `certificate`: PEM-encoded X.509 certificate

Remove an X.509 certificate from a namespace.

This method disassociates a certificate from a namespace, removing certificate-based authentication.

**Use Cases:**
- Certificate rotation
- Revoke certificate-based access
- Clean up expired certificates

**Parameters:**
- `namespace_id`: UUID of the namespace
- `certificate_id`: UUID of the certificate to remove

**DEPRECATED** - Assign a Key Access Server (KAS) to a namespace for key management.

This method associates a KAS with a namespace, enabling centralized key management for all attributes in the namespace.

**Use Cases:**
- Configure namespace-level KAS
- Set up default key management for all attributes
- Enable centralized key operations

**Parameters:**
- `namespace_id`: UUID of the namespace
- `key_access_server_id`: UUID of the KAS

**DEPRECATED** - Remove a Key Access Server (KAS) from a namespace.

This method disassociates a KAS from a namespace, removing namespace-level key management.

**Use Cases:**
- Namespace-level KAS migration
- Remove key management from namespace
- Clean up KAS associations

**Parameters:**
- `namespace_id`: UUID of the namespace
- `key_access_server_id`: UUID of the KAS to remove

item.description: Namespace management - Create and organize attribute namespaces

item.name: Attributes

request.description:
Create a new attribute within a namespace.

**Namespace Lifecycle Step 2/5**

Attributes define the data classification properties. Each attribute has a name and belongs to a namespace.

**Rules:**
- HIERARCHY: Values have ordered relationships (e.g., Top Secret > Secret > Confidential)
- ALL_OF: All attribute values must be present
- ANY_OF: Any attribute value is sufficient

**Auto-saves:** `attribute_id` for use in subsequent requests
List all attributes, optionally filtered by namespace and state.
Get details of a specific attribute by ID.
Update attribute metadata.
Deactivate an attribute and all its values.

Retrieve multiple attribute values by their fully qualified names (FQNs).

FQN format: `namespace/attr/AttributeName/value/ValueName`

**Options:**
- `with_subject_maps`: Include subject mappings
- `with_resource_maps`: Include resource mappings

Assign a public key to an attribute for encryption.

This method associates a public key with an attribute, enabling encryption of data tagged with this attribute. The key can be either locally stored or remotely referenced.

**Use Cases:**
- Enable encryption for attribute-based access control
- Set up key material for TDF encryption
- Configure attribute-level cryptographic protection

**Parameters:**
- `attribute_id`: UUID of the attribute
- `public_key.local`: PEM-encoded public key (local storage)
- `public_key.remote`: URL to remote public key (alternative to local)

Assign a public key to a specific attribute value.

This method associates a public key with a specific attribute value, enabling fine-grained encryption control at the value level rather than the attribute level.

**Use Cases:**
- Different encryption keys for different classification levels
- Value-specific cryptographic protection
- Granular key management for hierarchical attributes

**Parameters:**
- `value_id`: UUID of the attribute value
- `public_key.local`: PEM-encoded public key (local storage)
- `public_key.remote`: URL to remote public key (alternative to local)

Remove a public key from an attribute.

This method disassociates a public key from an attribute, disabling encryption operations that depend on this key.

**Use Cases:**
- Key rotation - remove old keys
- Revoke encryption capability
- Clean up unused key associations

**Parameters:**
- `attribute_id`: UUID of the attribute
- `public_key_id`: UUID of the public key to remove

Remove a public key from a specific attribute value.

This method disassociates a public key from an attribute value, disabling value-level encryption operations.

**Use Cases:**
- Value-level key rotation
- Remove encryption from specific classification levels
- Clean up value-specific key associations

**Parameters:**
- `value_id`: UUID of the attribute value
- `public_key_id`: UUID of the public key to remove

**DEPRECATED** - Assign a Key Access Server (KAS) to an attribute for key management.

This method associates a KAS with an attribute, enabling centralized key management and access control.

**Use Cases:**
- Configure KAS for attribute-based encryption
- Set up key rewrap endpoints
- Enable centralized key management

**Parameters:**
- `attribute_id`: UUID of the attribute
- `key_access_server_id`: UUID of the KAS

**DEPRECATED** - Assign a Key Access Server (KAS) to a specific attribute value.

This method associates a KAS with an attribute value, enabling value-level key management.

**Use Cases:**
- Different KAS for different classification levels
- Value-specific key management
- Granular KAS assignment for hierarchical attributes

**Parameters:**
- `value_id`: UUID of the attribute value
- `key_access_server_id`: UUID of the KAS

**DEPRECATED** - Remove a Key Access Server (KAS) from an attribute.

This method disassociates a KAS from an attribute, removing centralized key management.

**Use Cases:**
- KAS migration
- Remove key management capability
- Clean up KAS associations

**Parameters:**
- `attribute_id`: UUID of the attribute
- `key_access_server_id`: UUID of the KAS to remove

**DEPRECATED** - Remove a Key Access Server (KAS) from a specific attribute value.

This method disassociates a KAS from an attribute value, removing value-level key management.

**Use Cases:**
- Value-level KAS migration
- Remove key management from specific classification levels
- Clean up value-specific KAS associations

**Parameters:**
- `value_id`: UUID of the attribute value
- `key_access_server_id`: UUID of the KAS to remove

item.description: Attribute management - Create and manage data attributes

item.name: Attribute Values

request.description:
Create a new value for an attribute.

**Namespace Lifecycle Step 3/5**

Values are the actual data classification levels or categories.

Example hierarchy:
- TopSecret (level 3)
- Secret (level 2)
- Confidential (level 1)
- Public (level 0)

**Auto-saves:** `value_id` for use in subsequent requests
Create TopSecret classification value.
Create Confidential classification value.
List all values for an attribute.
Get details of a specific attribute value by ID.
Update attribute value metadata.
Deactivate an attribute value.

item.description: Attribute value management - Create and manage classification values

item.name: Subject Mappings

request.description:
Match subject properties against subject mappings to find applicable attribute values.

**Input:**
- Subject properties (email, role, group, etc.)
- Actions being requested

**Returns:**
- Attribute values the subject can access
- Matching subject mappings

**Use Cases:**
- Determine what data a user can access
- Real-time entitlement resolution
- Policy evaluation

Map subjects (users/entities) to attribute values with specific actions.

**Namespace Lifecycle Step 4/5**

Subject mappings define WHO can perform WHAT actions on data with specific attributes.

**Standard Actions:**
- STANDARD_ACTION_DECRYPT: Decrypt and read data
- STANDARD_ACTION_TRANSMIT: Forward/share data
- STANDARD_ACTION_MODIFY: Edit data

**Existing Subject:**
Use `existing_subject_mappings` to reference an existing subject condition set.

Create a subject mapping with inline subject condition set.

**Subject Selectors:**
- `.emailAddress`: User email
- `.username`: Username
- `.groups`: User group membership
- `.role`: User role

**Operators:**
- IN: Value must be in the list
- NOT_IN: Value must not be in the list
List all subject mappings.
Get details of a specific subject mapping.
Update subject mapping actions and metadata.
Delete a subject mapping.

Bulk cleanup operation to delete all unmapped subject condition sets.

This method removes all subject condition sets that are not currently mapped to any attributes or values. Useful for cleaning up orphaned condition sets.

**Use Cases:**
- Clean up orphaned subject condition sets
- Maintenance operations
- Remove unused policy artifacts
- Database cleanup

**Warning:** This operation is irreversible. Ensure condition sets are truly unused before deletion.

**Returns:**
- Count of deleted condition sets
- List of deleted condition set IDs

item.description: Subject mapping management - Map users/entities to attribute values with permissions

item.name: Resource Mappings

request.description:
Create a resource mapping group to organize related resource mappings.

**Groups organize mappings by:**
- Namespace
- Category (e.g., security, compliance, data type)
- Purpose (e.g., auto-classification, DLP)

**Use Cases:**
- Organize keyword lists
- Group related classification rules
- Manage mapping sets by purpose
List all resource mapping groups, optionally filtered by namespace.
Get details of a specific resource mapping group.
Update resource mapping group metadata.

Delete a resource mapping group.

**Warning:** This will fail if the group contains any resource mappings.

Map keywords/terms to attribute values for automatic classification.

**Namespace Lifecycle Step 5/5**

Resource mappings enable automatic attribute assignment based on content keywords.

**Use Cases:**
- Keyword-based auto-classification
- Content scanning and tagging
- DLP policy enforcement

**Example:** Documents containing "secret" are automatically tagged with Secret classification.
List all resource mappings.
Get details of a specific resource mapping.
Update resource mapping terms and metadata.
Delete a resource mapping.

item.description: Resource mapping management - Map keywords to attributes for auto-classification

item.name: Subject Condition Sets

request.description:
Create reusable subject condition sets for complex subject matching.

**Boolean Operators:**
- AND: All conditions must be true
- OR: At least one condition must be true

**Condition Structure:**
- Multiple condition groups can be combined
- Each group has conditions with a boolean operator
- Conditions check subject properties against values
List all subject condition sets.
Get details of a specific subject condition set.
Update subject condition set metadata.

Delete a subject condition set.

**Warning:** This will fail if the condition set is referenced by any subject mappings.

item.description: Subject condition set management - Create reusable subject matching rules

item.name: Key Access Servers

request.description:
Register a Key Access Server (KAS) for key management.

**Public Key Options:**
- `remote`: URL to fetch public key
- `local`: Inline PEM-encoded public key

**KAS Configuration:**
KAS instances handle encryption/decryption operations and must be registered before use.
Register a KAS with inline public key.
List all registered Key Access Servers.
Get details of a specific Key Access Server.
Update Key Access Server configuration.
Delete a Key Access Server registration.

Create a new cryptographic key in the KAS registry.

This method creates a new key entry associated with a Key Access Server. The key can be used for encryption and key wrapping operations.

**Use Cases:**
- Generate new key material for KAS
- Set up encryption keys for attribute protection
- Initialize KAS with cryptographic keys

**Supported Algorithms:**
- `rsa:2048` - RSA 2048-bit
- `rsa:3072` - RSA 3072-bit
- `rsa:4096` - RSA 4096-bit
- `ec:secp256r1` - ECDSA P-256
- `ec:secp384r1` - ECDSA P-384

**Parameters:**
- `key_access_server_id`: UUID of the KAS
- `algorithm`: Key algorithm and size
- `public_key`: PEM-encoded public key

Retrieve key details by ID from the KAS registry.

This method fetches the metadata and public key material for a specific key.

**Use Cases:**
- Retrieve key information for encryption
- Verify key configuration
- Audit key usage

**Returns:**
- Key ID and metadata
- Algorithm information
- Public key material
- Associated KAS details

**Parameters:**
- `key_id`: UUID of the key

List all keys for a specific Key Access Server.

This method retrieves all cryptographic keys associated with a KAS, useful for key management and auditing.

**Use Cases:**
- Audit all keys for a KAS
- Key inventory management
- Identify keys for rotation

**Returns:**
- List of keys with metadata
- Algorithm information
- Creation timestamps
- Key status (active/deprecated)

**Parameters:**
- `key_access_server_id`: UUID of the KAS

Update key metadata in the KAS registry.

This method updates the metadata associated with a key. The actual key material cannot be changed; use rotation for key updates.

**Use Cases:**
- Update key descriptions
- Modify key metadata
- Tag keys for organization

**Note:** Key material (public/private keys) cannot be updated. Use `RotateKey` for key material changes.

**Parameters:**
- `key_id`: UUID of the key
- `metadata`: Updated metadata fields

Rotate a cryptographic key (create new, deprecate old).

This method performs key rotation by creating a new key and marking the old key as deprecated. The old key remains available for decryption of existing data.

**Use Cases:**
- Regular key rotation for security
- Respond to key compromise
- Upgrade to stronger algorithms

**Process:**
1. Create new key with provided material
2. Mark old key as deprecated
3. Return new key ID
4. Old key remains available for decryption

**Parameters:**
- `key_id`: UUID of the key to rotate
- `new_key.algorithm`: Algorithm for new key
- `new_key.public_key`: PEM-encoded public key for new key

Set the base encryption key for a Key Access Server.

This method designates a specific key as the base/default key for a KAS. The base key is used for default encryption operations when no specific key is requested.

**Use Cases:**
- Configure default encryption key
- Set initial KAS key
- Change primary encryption key

**Important:** Only one base key can be active per KAS.

**Parameters:**
- `key_access_server_id`: UUID of the KAS
- `key_id`: UUID of the key to set as base

Retrieve the base encryption key for a Key Access Server.

This method fetches the current base/default key for a KAS.

**Use Cases:**
- Retrieve default encryption key
- Verify base key configuration
- Audit default key usage

**Returns:**
- Base key ID and metadata
- Algorithm information
- Public key material

**Parameters:**
- `key_access_server_id`: UUID of the KAS

List attribute-to-key mappings for a Key Access Server.

This method retrieves all mappings between attributes/values and their associated encryption keys. Useful for understanding which keys protect which attributes.

**Use Cases:**
- Audit key-attribute associations
- Understand encryption configuration
- Plan key rotation impact
- Verify attribute protection

**Returns:**
- List of attribute-to-key mappings
- Associated namespace information
- Key details for each mapping

**Parameters:**
- `key_access_server_id`: UUID of the KAS

**DEPRECATED** - List all grants for a Key Access Server.

This method retrieves all access grants associated with a KAS. Grants define which entities can access keys for decryption.

**Use Cases:**
- Audit KAS access permissions
- Review grant policies
- Compliance reporting

**Returns:**
- List of grants with subject details
- Associated attribute/value information
- Grant conditions

**Parameters:**
- `key_access_server_id`: UUID of the KAS

item.description: Key Access Server management - Register and manage KAS instances

request.description:
Create a new policy action.

Actions define what operations can be performed on data (e.g., TRANSMIT, DECRYPT, ENCRYPT).

List all policy actions.

Returns all available actions configured in the system.

Get a specific policy action by ID.

Retrieve details of a single action.

Update an existing policy action.

Modify the action type or other properties.

Delete a policy action.

Removes the action from the system.

Create a new registered resource.

Registered resources define resource types that can be used in policies.

List all registered resources.

Returns all resource types configured in the system.

Get a specific registered resource by ID.

Retrieve details of a single resource type.

Update an existing registered resource.

Modify the resource type properties.

Delete a registered resource.

Removes the resource type from the system.

Create a new value for a registered resource.

Add a specific value option to a resource type.

List all values for a registered resource.

Returns all available values for a specific resource type.

Get a specific registered resource value by ID.

Retrieve details of a single resource value.

Get registered resource values by fully qualified names (FQNs).

Retrieve multiple values using their complete URIs.

Update an existing registered resource value.

Modify a value's properties.

Delete a registered resource value.

Removes the value from the system.

Create a new key provider configuration.

Configure a key management provider (e.g., AWS KMS, Azure Key Vault).

List all key provider configurations.

Returns all configured key management providers.

Get a specific key provider configuration by ID.

Retrieve details of a single provider configuration.

Update an existing key provider configuration.

Modify provider settings.

Delete a key provider configuration.

Removes the provider configuration from the system.

Create a new obligation.

Obligations define requirements that must be met (e.g., watermarking, logging).

List all obligations.

Returns all configured obligations in the system.

Get a specific obligation by ID.

Retrieve details of a single obligation.

Get obligations by fully qualified names (FQNs).

Retrieve multiple obligations using their complete URIs.

Delete an obligation.

Removes the obligation from the system.

Create a new value for an obligation.

Add a specific value option to an obligation.

Get a specific obligation value by ID.

Retrieve details of a single obligation value.

Get obligation values by fully qualified names (FQNs).

Retrieve multiple values using their complete URIs.

Delete an obligation value.

Removes the value from the system.

Update an existing obligation.

Modify obligation properties.

Update an existing obligation value.

Modify a value's properties.

Add a trigger to an obligation.

Define which actions trigger this obligation (e.g., TRANSMIT, DECRYPT).

Remove a trigger from an obligation.

Remove an action trigger from this obligation.

List all triggers for an obligation.

Returns all actions that trigger this obligation.

item.description:
Policy Service - Comprehensive policy and attribute management

**Complete Workflow:**
1. Create Namespace
2. Create Attribute
3. Create Attribute Values
4. Create Subject Mappings (who can access)
5. Create Resource Mappings (auto-classification rules)

This establishes a complete data classification and access control policy.

item.name: KAS Service

request.description:
Rewrap encrypted data encryption keys (DEKs) for authorized users.

**Process:**
1. Client sends encrypted DEK wrapped with KAS public key
2. KAS validates user entitlements against policy
3. If authorized, KAS rewraps DEK with user's public key
4. Client can then decrypt the DEK and access data

**Request Token:**
JWT containing:
- Encrypted DEK
- Data attributes
- User identity
- Client public key

Retrieve the KAS public key for encrypting DEKs.

**Use this key to:**
- Wrap data encryption keys before sending to KAS
- Validate KAS signatures

**Algorithms:**
- rsa:2048
- rsa:4096
- ec:secp256r1

Legacy endpoint for retrieving KAS public key.

**Deprecated:** Use PublicKey (POST) for new implementations.

item.description: KAS Service - Key Access Server for encryption key management and rewrapping

item.name: Wellknown Service

request.description:
Retrieve platform configuration and service discovery information.

**Returns:**
- Available services and endpoints
- Platform version information
- Feature flags and capabilities
- OAuth/OIDC configuration
- Public keys and certificates

**Use Cases:**
- Service discovery
- Client auto-configuration
- Version compatibility checking

item.description: Wellknown Service - Platform configuration and service discovery

item.name: Authorization Service

request.description:
Request authorization decisions for specific actions on resources.

**Decision Request:**
- **actions**: What action is being requested (DECRYPT, TRANSMIT, etc.)
- **entity_chain**: User/entity making the request with their attributes
- **resource_attributes**: Attributes of the resource being accessed

**Response:**
- PERMIT: Action is allowed
- DENY: Action is denied
- INDETERMINATE: Unable to make decision

**Use Cases:**
- Real-time access control decisions
- Policy enforcement at runtime
- Audit and compliance logging

Request multiple authorization decisions in a single call.

Checks if user can both DECRYPT and TRANSMIT the resource.

Request authorization decisions using the authenticated user's token.

**Simpler than GetDecisions:**
- Entity information extracted from auth token
- No need to specify entity_chain
- Uses bearer token for authentication

**Decision Request:**
- **actions**: What action is being requested
- **resource_attributes**: Attributes of the resource being accessed

**Response:**
- PERMIT: Action is allowed
- DENY: Action is denied
- INDETERMINATE: Unable to make decision

Retrieve all entitlements for a user or entity.

**Returns:**
- All attribute values the entity can access
- Actions permitted for each attribute
- Effective permissions based on subject mappings

**Scope:**
Optionally filter entitlements to specific attributes.

**Use Cases:**
- Display available data to users
- Client-side access control
- User permission auditing

Get an authorization decision (v2).

Determines if an action is allowed on resources with specific attributes.

Get multiple authorization decisions in bulk (v2).

Evaluate multiple authorization requests in a single call.

Get authorization decision for multiple resources (v2).

Evaluate a single action against multiple resources.

Get entitlements for entities (v2).

Retrieve all permissions and access rights for specified entities.

item.description: Authorization Service - Real-time authorization decisions and entitlement queries

item.name: Entity Resolution Service

request.description:
Create an entity chain from JWT tokens.

**Purpose:**
Construct a chain of entities from JWT tokens for authorization and policy evaluation.

**Request Fields:**
- `tokens`: Array of JWT tokens to process

**Use Cases:**
- Entity chain construction for authorization
- Multi-level authentication
- Delegated access scenarios

Resolve entities to their attributes and properties.

**Purpose:**
Retrieve detailed information about entities including their attributes, roles, and permissions.

**Request Fields:**
- `entities`: Array of entities to resolve
  - `id`: Entity identifier (e.g., email, username)
  - `entity_type`: Type of entity (e.g., user, service, group)

**Returns:**
- Entity attributes and properties
- Associated roles and permissions
- Entity metadata

**Use Cases:**
- Entity attribute lookup
- User profile resolution
- Permission discovery

Create entity chains from authentication tokens (v2).

Resolves user/entity information from provided JWT tokens.

Resolve entity information (v2).

Expands entity identifiers into full entity details including attributes and group memberships.

item.description: Entity Resolution Service - Resolve and manage entity chains and attributes

item.name: Shared Service

request.description:
Retrieve entitlements for the authenticated user.

**Purpose:**
Get all entitlements and permissions for the current user based on their authentication token.

**Request Fields:**
- `entities`: Optional array of entities to scope entitlements

**Returns:**
- User's attribute value entitlements
- Permitted actions for each attribute
- Effective permissions

**Use Cases:**
- User permission discovery
- Client-side access control
- UI permission filtering
- Entitlement auditing

Transform a TDF to ICTDF (Intelligence Community TDF) format.

**Purpose:**
Convert TDF (Trusted Data Format) files to ICTDF format for Intelligence Community standards compliance.

**Request Fields:**
- `tdf`: Base64-encoded TDF content

**Returns:**
- ICTDF-formatted data

**Use Cases:**
- IC compliance
- Cross-classification domain exchange
- Standard format conversion

Transform a TDF to ZTDF (ZIP-based TDF) format.

**Purpose:**
Convert TDF files to ZTDF format, which uses ZIP compression for efficient storage and transmission.

**Request Fields:**
- `tdf`: Base64-encoded TDF content

**Returns:**
- ZTDF-formatted data (ZIP-compressed)

**Use Cases:**
- File size optimization
- Bandwidth-constrained environments
- Legacy system compatibility

item.description: Shared Service - Common utility operations including entitlements and TDF transformations

item.name: Tagging PDP Service

request.description:
Process content items through the PDP to produce tags.

**Request Fields:**
- `items`: Array of ContentItem objects
- `type`: Optional top-level content type
- `options`: TagRequestOptions with processing mode

**Modes:**
- ALL: Process all stages
- TAG_EXTRACT: Content extraction + tag extraction
- TAG_EXTRACT_AND_PROCESS: Extraction + processing
- EXTRACT_GENERATE_TOKENS: Generate encrypted tokens
Process content items and return tags per individual content item plus cross-content tags.
Process tags to generate assertions or encrypted search tokens.

Stream content for tagging - server streaming RPC.

This method processes content in a streaming fashion, allowing large files to be tagged without loading entirely into memory. The server streams back tagging results as content is processed.

**Use Cases:**
- Tag large documents efficiently
- Real-time content classification
- Stream-based content analysis
- Process multiple content chunks

**Important Notes:**
- This is a server streaming RPC endpoint
- May not work optimally with regular HTTP/JSON clients
- Best accessed via pure gRPC clients with streaming support
- Consider using non-streaming `Tag` methods for simpler use cases

**Content Format:**
- `desc.type`: MIME type of content (e.g., 'application/pdf', 'text/plain')
- `desc.id`: Unique identifier for tracking
- `binary`: Base64-encoded content chunk

**Parameters:**
- `items`: Array of content items to process
- Each item contains description and binary data

**Returns (streamed):**
- Tag results as content is processed
- Classification labels and confidence scores
- Processing metadata

item.description: Tagging PDP Service - Content analysis and tag generation

request.description:
Get the Key Access Server (KAS) configuration.

Returns current KAS configuration including endpoint and settings.

Set the Key Access Server (KAS) configuration.

Configure KAS endpoint and related settings.

Get the Outlook integration configuration.

Returns current Outlook plugin configuration.

Set the Outlook integration configuration.

Configure Outlook plugin settings.

Get the Secure Viewer configuration.

Returns current Secure Viewer settings.

Set the Secure Viewer configuration.

Configure Secure Viewer settings and features.

Get the Tagging PDP (Policy Decision Point) configuration.

Returns current tagging PDP settings.

Set the Tagging PDP (Policy Decision Point) configuration.

Configure tagging PDP settings.

List all configuration settings.

Returns all configuration across the web admin interface.

Check if there are pending configuration changes.

Returns whether any unsaved configuration changes exist.

Assign a certificate to a namespace.

Associates an X.509 certificate with a specific namespace for cryptographic operations.

List all certificates assigned to a namespace.

Returns all certificates associated with the specified namespace.

Remove a certificate from a namespace.

Disassociates a certificate from the specified namespace.

Get the version information of the Data Security Platform.

Returns version details including build number, commit hash, and release information.

Check health status of the service.

Returns the current health status. Empty service name checks overall server health.

List all services available for health checking.

Returns a list of all service names that can be checked for health status.

Watch health status of a service (streaming).

NOTE: This is a streaming endpoint and may not work well via HTTP/gRPC-gateway.
Returns continuous health status updates.
